channel.title: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
channel.description:
Just want to share this juice...
WAITING FOR YOUR SONG TO HIT 1K? :hear_no_evil:
STREAMIFY IS READY TO GIVE YOU 1,000 FREE PLAYS (in streaming value, more streaming more royalties)
[https://streamify.me/order-spotify-free.html](https://streamify.me/order-spotify-free.html)
[spoiler]Limit of one free order per artist and Streamify account[/spoiler]
*NO BOT cheat or what so ever. Just to keep your song/track distributed and moving :muscle:
[Edited] **PLEASE DO NOT USE STREAMIFY SERVICE, IF YOU DO IT MIGHT LEAD ISSUE TO YOUR SPOTIFY ARTIST ACCOUNTS**
Read more on the FAQ.
![image|690x387](upload://3gIkuuRI5QXBgopXiqz6nduJVXb.png)

For the last point, I expect that they have had much experience with their promotion, and know that within 5 days (could be 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5), your track will most likely have 1,000 plays.

They could be bots too, but that point isn’t very convincing as well.

item.title: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
The United States thing is a bit sketchy, but your other points were just forced. I can see how it would take a day for them to get into contact with all of their partners to promote your music.

Don’t want to defend the company too much because it can very well be not legit, but none of your points provide valid evidence that it is a scam.

Either way though, the service still is sketchy and I would stay away from it.

Read full topic

item.title: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
item.dc:creator: stereofield
item.description:
Do Not Use This

Since this is such a sketchy service, I see no reason to trust their FAQs, where they claim that all of their tracks are played by “music promoters, DJ’s, online radio stations”, etc.

In case you don’t know, this is “streaming fraud”, a.k.a. fake plays on Spotify that you earn money from. Again don’t do it bye

Other Things (click for more details)

Edit: @cgedius I’m not mad at you, this post is more directed to anyone who sees this thread and thinks “Oh! This is a great idea!”

Read full topic

item.title: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Was thinking of giving this a go this weekend – after some research about Streamify.

Lucky I did…

Digital Music News – 2 Nov 17

Spotify Removed My Album Because Of Seemingly Fake Streams

Sure enough, within a few days I noticed the song had been added to a fairly popular user generated playlist (of about 50,000 followers) that they must have

 
As suspected, it’s likely using some dodgy techniques that Spotify will punish the artist for.

So, this is a no-go for me. I won’t be touching it.
My advice to others would be to use it at your own risk, knowing what could happen.

 
Time to look for legit playlist pluggers instead.

Read full topic
item.source: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!

item.title: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
$2,250 for 2million plays danggg

If those plays are all recorded as legit, then that represents an insanely good investment.

Spotify = ~$0.00397 per stream

2 million Spotify plays = ~$8000 pay-out. That’s a 250% profit.

Not to mention the additional unsponsored plays you’d get from the increased exposure.

 
It’s looking like a good route to establish an audience, which ideally becomes self-sustaining – but which you could always ‘top-up’ with an additional push with each release.

Read full topic

item.title: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
cgedius:

just drop it anywhere available, more exposure for yourself

Like I said, I’d be worried that Spotify might identify it as gaming the system and either render it useless somehow or penalise the artist account.

Like how Google is increasingly good at identifying paid link promotion and will actually penalise the beneficiary by pushing them down the rankings.

This one’s probably ok, but not all exposure is good.

Read full topic

item.title: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!

item.description:
akabillposters:

It’s says no bots, but depending on how the plays are acquired, I’d worry if it’s identifiable by Spotify as somehow ‘gaming’ the system and likely to result in the artist account being penalised.

yeah, i’m worried about that too. But the the website looks legit.

and the distribution happens only in US (their partner list)

akabillposters:

I’m going to do more reading on the site and may well give it a spin, maybe even try one of the larger bundles, if the 1000 free plays offer works out.

just drop it anywhere available, more exposure for yourself.

[edit]
anyway, i think a good option as a startup to promote for the first timer… if it’s indeed working as they said well… a good option.

$2,250 for 2million plays danggg

item.source: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!

item.title: Spotify Plays: 1K Plays with Streamify? USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I’m torn on this, in principle.

It’s says no bots, but depending on how the plays are acquired, I’d worry if it’s identifiable by Spotify as somehow ‘gaming’ the system and likely to result in the artist account being penalised.

If they’re acquired simply through paid-for playlist promotion – which is standard practice these days – and the plays happen organically that way, I’d be more up for it.

 
[Edit…]

How are you distributing plays?

Spotify track plays are sent to our huge partner list that includes music promoters, DJ’s, online radio stations, playslists and various other parties. We provide them only the Spotify URI of the tracks you give us. We do not provide partners with any information about who has requested those plays.

Seems like a promotion network. If it’s legit, they would be real plays and should be fine, and as mentioned, pretty much the standard pay-to-play playlist promotion model commonly used by artists and labels of all sizes these days.

I’m going to do more reading on the site and may well give it a spin, maybe even try one of the larger bundles, if the 1000 free plays offer works out.

Every release should have a marketing budget.

 

https://www.youtube.com/embed/dm6wgSZkcEY

Read full topic
